basics.name: Goo Mijin
basics.label: AI Engineer & Researcher
basics.summary: I am a student at Konkuk University, majoring in both Civil & Environmental Engineering and Computer Engineering. My academic and professional interests lie in GIS, Construction data, and disaster safety data.

work.name: LightVision Inc.
work.summary: Developed a fire detection model for parking lot safety management. Actively participated in all stages of the process, including data collection, data processing, AI model customization, AI model quantization, and deployment. Additionally, contributed to the development of a facial recognition system

education.institution: University of Konkuk, Seoul, Republic of Korea

projects.name: Automated Sports Commentary Generation(Gemmentary)
projects.summary: Developed a program designed to generate sports commentary based on a short video clip and a single news update, enabling a full and comprehensive commentary experience.

projects.name: Nearest Nearbors Adaptive Rockhead Depth Prediction
projects.summary: Conducted a detailed study on methods for augmenting well data by considering the number of neighboring wells around each well. This project involved analyzing various data augmentation techniques to improve the accuracy and reliability of well data, taking into account the spatial distribution and proximity of neighboring wells.

projects.name: Construction Resource Management using Reinforcement Learning
projects.summary: Efficient resource allocation is crucial in construction projects as it significantly impacts cost, duration, and quality. This project focused on the strategic allocation of various construction resources based on the specific needs, timing, location, and availability at each site.

projects.name: Worker Injury Detection and Alert System in Construction Sites(vigilant)
projects.summary: The focus of this research is to develop a system for detecting and alerting physical injuries of workers caused by construction accidents. Utilize wearable devices to collect data such as GPS, heart rate, accelerometer, and step count to monitor workers' entry into hazardous areas and detect real-time physical injuries and abnormal conditions. Additionally, develop a system that integrates worker data with AI-powered CCTV analysis to provide accident information to managers for prompt response.
